issues.description: Remote address parsing uses strings.LastIndex to split host and port but does not handle IPv6 addresses (e.g. "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "2001:db8::1"). As a result, IPv6 hosts are misidentified as names and ports are misâ€‘parsed.
Host header parsing also relies on strings.LastIndex(':') and fails for IPv6 hosts. Unbracketed IPv6 addresses or addresses with ports are split incorrectly, leading to wrong net.host.* attributes.
